item.title: Preventing the stampede: Request collapsing in the Vercel CDN
item.description: üöÄ When deploying Next.js apps with Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR), users may experience “cache stampedes.” This occurs when multiple requests for the same page trigger separate function invocations, leading to wasted resources and potential downtime. üåç Vercel’s CDN now tackles this issue with request collapsing. Only one request per region will invoke a function for uncached paths, while others wait for the cached response. üîß This feature requires no manual configuration, as Vercel…

item.title: Request collapsing for ISR cache misses
item.description: üöÄ Vercel CDN introduces request collapsing to manage cache misses for ISR pages. This feature prevents cache stampedes by consolidating simultaneous requests into a single regeneration per region. As a result, it enhances reliability and significantly reduces backend load. No extra configuration is needed, as cacheability is automatically detected. For more details, check out their blog post! #Vercel #CDN #WebDevelopment #ISR #Caching

item.title: Vercel Open Source Program: Summer cohort
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news from Vercel! The Vercel Open Source Program has announced its summer 2025 cohort. This initiative supports developers by providing resources, credits, and assistance to enhance their projects. This season features 28 innovative projects, including AI-powered calendars and stylish React Native components. Learn more about these amazing contributions! #Vercel #OpenSource #DeveloperCommunity #Innovation #TechForGood

item.title: Migrating by direct transfer is generally available
item.description: üöÄ GitLab 18.3 introduces direct transfer for migrating groups and projects, making it easier for users to copy resources between instances. This feature simplifies the migration process, allowing you to move entire top-level groups with sub-groups and projects without manual file exports. It supports user contribution mapping and works reliably with large projects. For those using GitLab.com, the feature is enabled by default. Self-managed users should check their application settings. üåê…

item.title: Veo 3 Fast and new image-to-video capabilities
item.description: üöÄ Google has launched Veo 3 Fast, a new model designed for speed and cost-effectiveness. It allows developers to create high-quality videos quickly, supporting both text-to-video and image-to-video capabilities. This functionality is available through the Gemini API. With prices starting at $0.40/second for videos with audio, Veo 3 Fast is ideal for programmatic advertising and content creation at scale. #Google #Veo3 #VideoContent #TechNews #Developers
